That said, the MS boost from Cleaver might be overkill even then. I can go a game without getting Black Cleaver and still keep up just fine.

I agree. Though the inclusion of all this armor pen/shred seems to be a result of riot trying to push AD casters, from the style of {{champion:41}} to {{champion:92}}  into viability.

Without tons of armor pen, physical damage abilities would just be weaker versions of AP skills. Which is honestly fine, imo, because unlike AP casters, AD casters still have auto attack damage. Which should be incorporated into their damage, rather than seen as secondary to it. 

Yet you still see champions like {{champion:238}} who get an auto attack modifier, in this case on his passive, despite really not being in need of such an asset to his kit. He's already AD, he inherently has an easier time last hitting CS, and he doesn't need it at all for champion kills.

Riot has just been trying to expand AD's design space to include AD mages/casters, and the result is inherently contradictory to the fundamental design of the stat. **Attack Damage** was not designed to function as **Ability Power**. Just as **Ability Power** was never designed to function as **Attack Damage**. The more that riot tries to push this, the more the game's balance gets warped and malformed.

There has always been some degree of cross over, like Jax ult and Ashe Volley. Though they were the exceptions not the norm.

AD's are designed with auto attacking in mind, although it's fairly flawed. You can see that by how Talon must auto to proc his passive, Kha'Zix's passive empowers his autos, how Rengar's jump is just an auto, how Zed's passive gives him more auto attack damage, how Riven's passive is an auto attack empower, even Gangplank's.

The major flaws, I believe, is how these autos work. Early game, they're a huge safety net. A Zed who only hit a single Q when he ults will simply auto attack twice more to make up for it, and you can't stop him. Rengar's autoattack usage gives him insane dps when combined with his Q resets. A Riven who all ins, fails her combo, and simply doesn't have the damage, will just auto a few more times and kill a squishy anyway. Assassin's are burst based, and their autos mean they keep a level of unnecessary and unintended power.

My solution is to drastically lower the attack speed of all AD assassins. But, you ask, wouldn't this destroy their ability to weave autos into their combo's because of the slowed auto attack animation? Yes, it would. Unless, we artificially sped up their auto attack animation.

This means a Zed who combo's perfectly still gets in that 1 auto attack and weaves it smoothly into his E's and Q's, and kills his target as intended. But a Zed who fails his Q's can no longer auto attack multiple times to make up for the missed Q damage, unless for some reason his target stands there for over 3 seconds.

Of course, this hits their tower pushing and early game dps, so for the latter, I suggest their attack speed to be kept the same but the scaling to be lowered. AD assassins already chunk towers, the attack speed nerf would only put them on the same level as an AP mage, which is fine.

Riven is not specifically an assassin and is also balanced around being able to duel tanks, but this should not be a problem. Her fast combo will be unaffected, but perhaps a soft auto attack reset would need to be incorporated into her W to make up for that, which again, would not affect her assassination combo. So Riven's ability to take down a tank would also be ability based, rather than simply slapping away with 400 damage autos between combos.

>There has always been some degree of cross over, like Jax ult and Ashe Volley. Though they were the exceptions not the norm.

That's not actually true. There was a point in time early in S1 where AD ratios just weren't a thing. If you had an ability it either scaled with AP or nothing and that includes abilities which have AD ratios now like Volley and Leap Strike. I think the on exception to this was Parrrlay, which has always had an AD ratio, originally 1:1 because it's always been considered an AA.

Also on Jax's ult, it's newer than champions like Riven and Talon. Jax's ult was only changed to what it is now at the end of S1, before that it had the bonus AS part of his passive, the 3rd hit passive and bonus MR based on dodge on activation.
